title: when you're extremely positive get an s, dont feed a single kill and keep believing in your team.
body:
but theyre full premade so nobody honours you.

I pretty much prefered the old system. When i played exceptionally well with premades atleast i got the honor back. now it's worth too much so if you're matched with 5 premades your chances of getting honored are pretty much nihil :3

Not to bitch about anything but i just don't think you should be able to only honor your premades, basicly if you're premade you always honor people, so couldnt we just allow those people to honour atleast a single person extra that isn't premade with them? i don't know. I just think it's lame when you put up your best performance don't feed a single kill and hardcarry your adc keep chilling people out saying we got this. just to have him honor his 0/9 premade :(

Thanks for being an honorable player! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

Looking at the bright side: your team won, I'm assuming there was a full team voting bonus (otherwise it's possible that some of those premades just didn't vote) and it sounded like a pretty decent experience. What goes around comes around... but not necessarily immediately.

> Looking at the bright side: your team won, I'm assuming there was a full team voting bonus (otherwise it's possible that some of those premades just didn't vote) and it sounded like a pretty decent experience. What goes around comes around... but not necessarily immediately.

While it is wonderful to win a game rather than lose one, it is rather disheartening to receive absolutely no honor from carrying a game and being a positive player because each teammate can honor only one person. I recently had a game where things were looking bleak to start with a 0-6 lead on the enemy team, but I did not rage, I did not even speak I simply pinged mias, objectives, and proceeded to carry my team through superior shotcalling and asskickery. I ended the game 14-1-7, most gold earned, most cs, obviously the hard carry of the team. I honored our ADC who definitely helped me out with the workload. However, I did not receive a single honor at all from my team even though there was an honor bonus for everyone on the team voting to honor someone. This hurt me as a player personally, as I felt it rude and just downright wrong to not have my work recognized. So yes, we won the game, but I lost in the end because of a system that does not let a team show credit to more than one player at a time.

Welcome to the real world, where half the good stuff you do will likely go unnoticed by most people. It isn't fun but its a reality. You cant rely on others praise or recognition to give you satisfaction. Just keep doing what is right, be a good person, be helpful, be respectful, and take pride in that. Doesn't matter if people don't see it, someone eventually will.

?


First of all you can honor anyone on your team regardless of premades.
Secondly nobody still knows that honoring your premade does basically nothing because riot thought about this case (and told so pretty much infinite amount of times everywhere they could), so people still honour their friends randomly without really giving a shit about whoever else was in the game.


And it's their choice to honour you or not, just because you carried I am not obliged to honour you, even if you weren't talking shit, lol.
